quest.name: Messages from Distant Shores
journal:
P'obyano's work is not yet done, which means that neither is yours...should you be so inclined.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

You have graciously agreed to assist the ever-overworked P'obyano with retrieving the curious message bottles that have been washing in on the tides in increasingly overwhelming numbers. Scour the beach for these mysterious missives, and bring what you find back to her, that she might share with you the contents.

※There are eighteen unique messages to be read in all, divided amongst three varieties of bottles. There are six unique messages contained in small bottles, seven messages contained in medium bottles, and five messages contained in large bottles. The letters housed in small and medium bottles will be chosen at random. Those in large bottles will vary depending on your progression through the main scenario.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.
You come upon one of the enigmatic messages in a bottle from the sands of Bloodshore. Taking it safely in hand, you begin to stride back toward P'obyano, eager to reveal the words housed within.

Upon delivering the bottle to P'obyano, the Faire attendant promptly extracts the message and suggests you read it in a quiet spot. Though the sender has decided to obscure their precise identity, the letter is clearly a message of gratitude from one of the many individuals you have touched through your adventures. Heartened to know that your deeds have made an impact on the wider world around you, you stride off with renewed purpose. Should you be curious as to the contents of the remaining bottles, you need only speak to P'obyano and offer your assistance once more.
objectives: Retrieve a message in a bottle from the beach.
Deliver the message in a bottle to P'obyano.

dialogue.name: POBYANO
dialogue.text: After all you've already done, you're still willing to lend poor P'obyano a helping hand? You truly are a saint! Or perhaps you're just curious to find out what all these letters say? I couldn't blame you for that─I am too!

dialogue.name: POBYANO
dialogue.text: Anyhow, what with how many of them are washing in these days, I don't suppose they'll be too hard to find. Bring back to me what you've found, and I'll open them right up─my nails are quite suited for the task, mind you─so you can read the message at your leisure.

dialogue.name: POBYANO
dialogue.text: Have you found any of the bottled messages yet? It shouldn't be hard─why, there's so many of them that sometimes I feel like I'm tripping over one every other second! If you find one, just bring it back to me. I'm curious what they all say, too, after all!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The other bottles appear to have been washed away with the tide...

dialogue.name: POBYANO
dialogue.text: Is that a message in a bottle I see in your hands, or are you just happy to see me?

dialogue.name: POBYANO
dialogue.text: Splendid! For doing your part to clean up the beach, I'm more than happy to furnish you with this spiffy, shiny, absolutely official Rising token.

dialogue.name: POBYANO
dialogue.text: You'll want to hold on to it─and acquire even more, if you can─so that you can exchange them for any of the wide array of exclusive festival goods and accessories available from our vendor.

dialogue.name: POBYANO
dialogue.text: In the meantime, why don't you take the letter and find a quiet spot around here to read it? I imagine that gazing up at the fireworks over the sea would do an excellent job of setting the scene. Whoever wrote this, and wherever they are, no doubt they want nothing more than for their words to reach an adventurer like you.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter I-)How quickly the years have flown by since we first set up that message board on an unassuming street corner. Seeing the many and myriad words written there each day never fails to fill our hearts with joy and gratitude.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter I-)Perhaps most enjoyable of all to read are the announcements of various festivities organized by adventurers. Gatherings of fellow clansmen, adventurous journeys to far-flung lands, and all sorts of delightful events.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter I-)We tip our caps to the passionate adventurers who pour their heart and soul into organizing these outings. One might liken them to a lodestone, drawing people in and bringing like minds together wherever they go.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Small Bottle, Letter I-)Finally, we would express our thanks to all of you who take the time to keep diaries of your journeys. It is a pleasure and an honor both to have the privilege of sharing in your adventures.
With best wishes,
The Keepers of the Message Boards

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter II-)We hear that these days, it's all the rage for adventurers to gather in small groups and paint portraits of themselves striking stylish poses.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter II-)As humble art supply provisioners, all we can do is provide the canvas, the palette, the paint, and the brush by which such works of art can be crafted. And we realize there is much we still must do to allow adventurers to fully realize their aesthetic visions.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter II-)And yet, seeing the masterworks you are already creating each day instills us with pride and the passion to continue pursuing our craft.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Small Bottle, Letter II-)We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for allowing us to take part in this creative collaboration, and look forward to providing you with yet more materials to add to your artist's workshop in the future.
Wishing you eternal inspiration,
The Art Provisioners of Eorzea

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter III-)The other day at the aetheryte plaza, I happened upon a minstrel cheerfully strumming a tune before an admiring crowd of adventurers and townspeople.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter III-)Impromptu concerts like these have been happening more and more of late, and I daresay nothing fills our hearts with joy quite like seeing people of all ages, backgrounds, and walks of life bonding over a love of music.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Small Bottle, Letter III-)To all the talented composers and instrumentalists out there, we thank you for providing a soundtrack to stir our own hearts. We hope that the music of Eorzea has served to render your adventures even richer and more memorable.
Ever in harmony with you,
A Humble Instrument-maker

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter IV-)I still remember the day. Fresh off the boat after a long voyage across the Ruby Sea, I strode into the gleaming Gold Saucer. I found an open space in one of the parlors, set up my table, and began to stack my tiles atop it.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter IV-)Anxiety gripped me to the depths of my body and soul. What if Eorzeans had no interest in the Doman diversion I sought to provide? Would my long journey prove to be for naught?

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter IV-)Fortunately, my worries soon melted away. Within hours, the Manderville Tables were teeming with visitors─locals and travelers from far abroad alike─each more eager than the next to try their hand at the time-honored game of mahjong.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Small Bottle, Letter IV-)I am no mighty adventurer, and there is only so much I can do for this realm. And so I hope that, in some small way, the game I teach can serve to lighten adventurers' days, and relieve them from the many burdens they bear.
Until we meet at the tables,
An Anonymous Mahjong Tutor

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter I-)The mighty walls of Ul'dah were not built by one man. There were those that hewed the stones, and those that polished them. Those that carried them, and those that stacked them one atop the other until they reached the towering height you see today...

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter I-)And it is not just the walls. Much of what you see in the world is, in fact, the sum total of the blood, sweat, and tears of countless men and women whose names and faces you will never see.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter I-)But there is one more who is essential to truly realize the creation of these wonders...and that is you. For without you, all the efforts of those nameless artisans would mean nothing at all.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Medium Bottle, Letter I-)And so we speak in unison when we say...thank you. Always remember that you are the reason we devote ourselves to our craft.
With gratitude,
The Nameless Artisans of Eorzea

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter V-)Lately, there is nothing I enjoy quite so much as walking the streets of Eorzea's residential districts, and stopping to admire the many homes open for public viewing.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter V-)Seeing the furnishings my colleagues and I crafted with love and care tastefully adorning such warm and welcoming homes─oftentimes in remarkably creative ways─is perhaps the single most enjoyable sight an artisan can experience.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter V-)At times, the layouts are so eccentric and unconventional that I fear it is only a matter of time before they come crashing to the ground...but I am nonetheless impressed with the sheer creativity on display.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Small Bottle, Letter V-)As for us, we will do all in our power to continue crafting stylish furnishings and ornaments. May you continue to find joy in decorating your happy homes.
With gratitude,
A Humble Woodworker

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter II-)A little bird tells me that Eorzea is a land where many a bard and minstrel plies their trade.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter II-)“Oh, what I would not give to visit that far-off land and hear their strummings with my own ears!” Such is the vain dream I hold in my heart each day, as I sit in this dark room, pounding away against a great machine of levels, dials, and blinking lights.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter II-)Countless sounds have been given life in this cold, dank place. Perhaps you have paid special heed to them, but doubtless many of you have not. There is no shame in this─on the contrary, this is proof that they have formed part of the natural fabric of this world.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Medium Bottle, Letter II-)And yet, at some point in your adventures, if you could pause for even a fleeting moment to take in all the sounds of the living world around you, nothing would give us greater pleasure.
In gratitude,
An Artisan of Acoustics

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter III-)To those who make a living in the world of the stage, audience reactions are everything. Each joyous cry, each shed tear...we feel it with you, our audience, and then some.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter III-)Even when the reviews are harsh, we do not look away. We listen to and reflect upon your every word, each time vowing to use it to provide more powerful and effective performances going forward.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Medium Bottle, Letter III-)There are times when the poets and playwrights ask more of us than we feel capable of providing, but never do we back down from a challenge. Everything we do, we do it for you─and we thank you for being an ever-appreciative audience.
Yours in gratitude,
A Humble Stage Director

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter IV-)From vast deserts and verdant forests to deep blue seas... From white-veiled snowfields to exotic townscapes, and sometimes even to distant worlds...

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter IV-)Many a vista we have painted on our canvases, from familiar surroundings to far-flung locales. If even one or two of them have left an impression on you, there is nothing that would make us happier.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter IV-)And yet, all we can do is provide the backdrop─the stage on which you, the star of this adventure, will shine.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Medium Bottle, Letter IV-)From skies of azure and seas of ruby to the gentle darkness that comes after the light. Ever will we continue to put brush to canvas, that you might bring the worlds we draw to life.
Ever with you,
A Humble Landscape Artist

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter V-)Nothing warms my heart quite so much as when I see adventurers about town walking around wearing the clothes and fashions that I designed.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter V-)At times, the color and outfit combinations are beyond anything I'd ever imagined! This, in turn, inspires me to not rest on my laurels, but rather to strive to create yet newer and more eclectic fashions.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Medium Bottle, Letter V-)So to you, who I may never meet, and whose name I may never know, I have only this to say: thank you from the bottom of my heart for allowing the clothes of my creation to walk with you.
Yours sincerely,
A Humble Fashion Designer

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter VI-)A tale is not complete the instant the author pens the final word.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter VI-)No, it is not until the reader then takes the tome in hand, and the words enter their eyes, their heart...only then does the story told in those pages truly come to life.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter VI-)One could say that you are not only the protagonist of this grand tale of adventure, but also─in a sense─one of its authors. Your thoughts, your decisions, your actions─all serve to dictate the course of the story.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Medium Bottle, Letter VI-)And so we hope, that you will continue to enjoy with all your heart your adventures here. May you ever continue to breathe life into this world.
Sincerely,
A Teller of Tales

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter VI-)We have no strength to lend you in battle, nor can we craft wondrous items to serve you in your adventures.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter VI-)We can't help you win a fortune at the Gold Saucer, nor can we lift your spirits with a happy tune.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Small Bottle, Letter VI-)At the end of the day, all we can truly offer is companionship─whatever small comfort you can derive from knowing that we'll always be at your side. And yet, for some reason─a reason for which we can only thank the gods─that's enough for you.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Small Bottle, Letter VI-)And so, we thank you: our friend, our master. Simply say the word, and we will follow you to the ends of the world and beyond. For you mean more to us than you will ever know.
Ever your faithful companions,
Your Minions

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter VII-)Hello, friend. Are you perchance enjoying the fireworks? You can be honest with me. After all, I'm just one of the humble artisans responsible for the show you saw today.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter VII-)To tell the truth, my colleagues and I are responsible for more than fireworks. Storms of pounding rain and bolts of lightning, auroras that dazzle in the sky, mystic lights and the glowing of crystals. The lights and mists that you see upon the stage are all crafted by our hands.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Medium Bottle, Letter VII-)Fireworks are a fleeting thing, are they not? They dazzle the eye and move the heart, but in the next instance they turn to smoke, then fade and vanish without a trace. Think, just for a moment, of how it must feel to put one's heart and soul─and hours of blood, sweat, and tears─into creating something that lasts but an instant.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Medium Bottle, Letter VII-)But please do not misunderstand. We say this not out of bitterness, but with honor and pride─for nothing gives us greater pleasure than to know that our humble efforts have, even in the smallest of ways, helped your star shine all the brighter. And know that we will continue to pour all of our inspiration and imagination into illuminating your grand stage.
Yours in obscurity,
A Humble Artisan

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter I-)Fledgling adventurer, I pray this message finds you well.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter I-)Though your journey has just begun, I sense you will yet make a name for yourself. We must all start somewhere, as I once did. And though not every avenue will lead to fame and glory, I have faith in you.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter I-)Wherever your travels may lead, always remember this: You are not alone. When you stumble, there are those who would catch you. When you lose your way, there are those who would guide you back to your path.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Large Bottle, Letter I-)Perhaps someday, you will be the one taking the lead, showing others how it's done. Until then, keep fighting the good fight, and may good fortune befall you.
Yours,
A Fellow Adventurer

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter II-)It feels like only yesterday that the vows sworn on the shores of Silvertear Lake marked the beginning of the Seventh Astral Era.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter II-)You may not remember me, but I was there alongside you─well, figuratively speaking─as we launched the attack on the Praetorium.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter II-)I'll never forget the way you cut through the imperial lines─like a hot knife through butter. My unit would've been slaughtered if you hadn't arrived when you did.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Large Bottle, Letter II-)I was sent back to my hometown to recover from my wounds, but I wish I could've thanked you in person. Still, I'm grateful for the chance to see my family again, and would have you know that they appreciate your heroic deeds every bit as much as I do.
Your comrade in arms,
A Fellow Grand Company Soldier

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter III-)I can still remember the day you came swooping into Ishgard on the back of that dragon. I recall that it took even Ser Aymeric a moment to realize you were friend and not foe.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter III-)I must admit, I was one of those archers prepared to fire upon your draconian steed. It's a good thing I was wearing my helmet, as I have no doubt my face was beet red with embarrassment when we saw it was you!

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter III-)Having said that, I'm sure I would've been lost among the crowd, as there were a fair few of us there to mark your return. Unfortunately, being one of the rank and file makes it rather difficult to directly express my gratitude for your brave deeds, which is why I chose to pen this letter.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Large Bottle, Letter III-)Even then, I must rely on the tides of fate to carry these words to you. Though as you have proven, miracles can─and often do─happen.
Ever your comrade,
A Devoted Temple Knight

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter IV-)I'd been a member of the Resistance for years, not that we ever had much luck against the Garleans. It felt like we went from one defeat to the next, our numbers growing smaller each time.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter IV-)But that all changed when you and the Alliance arrived. Your brave deeds turned the tide not only here in Ala Mhigo, but all the way over in Doma, from what I've heard. I'll bet those imperials hardly knew what had hit them.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter IV-)Even though the fighting here has come to an end, we face a hard road ahead. We'll need to band together as never before if we're to heal the wounds inflicted upon our land by the Garleans.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Large Bottle, Letter IV-)And yet we have faith. After all, it's you and your comrades who've given us this chance, and we'll be damned if we let it go to waste. You have our gratitude, hero.
Ever your comrade on the battlefield,
A Former Fighter of the Resistance

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter V-)I snuck this letter on board a certain apparatus before it was sent hurtling backwards through time and space. As it wasn't accounted for on the storage log, I could begin to calculate where─and when─it will eventually arrive.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter V-)Even if I were to succeed in sending it two centuries in the past, the odds that it will safely reach the hands of that hero of legend are infinitesimal at best. And yet, the chance is not zero, and it is in remote possibility that I place my hopes.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text: (-Large Bottle, Letter V-)My ancestor─the first of the name I now proudly bear─once told me that the hero he befriended was, for all of herhis many talents, above all a womanman possessed of great fortune. Fortune that suggested that the Twelve themselves truly did smile upon herhim.

dialogue.name: BOTTLELETTER
dialogue.text:
(-Large Bottle, Letter V-)In that sense, it's not unreasonable to expect that it is indeed you who is reading my words today. And so, I say: thank you, my friend. Thank you for saving our past, and giving us hope for a brighter future. And above all, please look after him, won't you?
Yours,
Biggs, Third of His Name
Eighteenth President of Garlond Ironworks
